raw_infobox.name: Shaquille O'Neal
raw_infobox.caption: O'Neal in 2023
raw_infobox.alt: Head and shoulders photograph of O'Neal smiling and holding a microphone
raw_infobox.high_school:
* {{nowrap|Fulda American High School}} (Fulda)
* Robert G. Cole Junior-Senior High School (San Antonio, Texas)
raw_infobox.highlights:
* 4× List of NBA champions (2000–2002, 2006)
* 3× NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award (2000–2002)
* NBA Most Valuable Player Award (1999)
* 15× List of NBA All-Stars (1993–1998, 2000–2007, 2009)
* 3× NBA All-Star Game Kobe Bryant Most Valuable Player Award (2000{{efn|co-MVP along with Tim Duncan}}, 2004, 2009{{efn|co-MVP along with Kobe Bryant}})
* 8× All-NBA Team (1997, 1999–2005)
* 2× All-NBA Team (1994, 1998)
* 4× All-NBA Team (1993, 1995, 1996, 2008)
* 3× NBA All-Defensive Team (1999, 2000, 2002)
* NBA Rookie of the Year Award (1992)
* NBA All-Rookie Team (1992)
* 2× List of NBA annual scoring leaders (1994, 1999)
* NBA anniversary teams (50 Greatest Players in NBA History, NBA 75th Anniversary Team)
* {{abbr|No.|Number}} 34 Los Angeles Lakers#Retired numbers
* No. 32 Miami Heat#Retired numbers
* No. 32 Orlando Magic#Retired numbers
* Associated Press College Basketball Player of the Year (1991)
* UPI College Basketball Player of the Year (1991)
* Adolph Rupp Trophy (1991)
* 2× Consensus first-team NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans (1991 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans, 1992 NCAA Men's Basketball All-Americans)
* List of NCAA Division I men's basketball season rebounding leaders (1991)
* List of NCAA Division I men's basketball season blocks leaders (1992)
* 2× SEC Male Athlete of the Year (1991, 1992)
* 2× Southeastern Conference Men's Basketball Player of the Year (1991, 1992)
* 3× First-team List of All-SEC men's basketball teams (1990, 1991, 1992)
* No. 33 LSU Tigers men's basketball#Retired numbers
* FIBA Basketball World Cup Most Valuable Player (1994 FIBA World Championship)
* USA Basketball Male Athlete of the Year (1994)
* McDonald's All-American Game (1989 McDonald's All-American Boys Game)
* First-team Parade All-America Boys Basketball Team (1989)
* Texas Mr. Basketball (1989)
